title: question about 3D calibration using a mirror for bottom view
body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.3
Env: Anaconda 
Browser: chrome


**Describe the problem**

Hello,

I am trying to use the 3D features using one camera to capture a side view and a reflected bottom view of a mouse crossing a clear platform (splitting the side and bottom views into separate videos).  The bottom views are then flipped along the horizontal axis to make it seem that the camera is below the platform.  

I used images of a checkerboard taken the same way for calibration.  All the corners for both views are correctly detected assigned, but when I run the check_undistortion, it seems to map the points off of the images somewhere in 3D-space (most of the mapped images are just black).  The locations of the checkerboard in the 3D plot don't move in the x-axis, which is how I moved it in the calibration pictures.

Is this because the 2nd "camera" is looking from the bottom (or is from a reflection?).  Are there restrictions to where the cameras can be placed in relation to each other or some way to tell deeplabcut that the image is from below?

I've attached a couple of the corners images and 3D plot.  Let me know if I'm not being clear with this.  Thanks for your help

Thong
